sub_topic: Calculation of efficiency of a refrigerator
message_1: A refrigerator works by transferring heat from its interior to the outside environment, requiring energy input to do so. If a refrigerator has an input power of 500 Watts and a cooling power of 250 Watts, what is its efficiency?
message_2:
The efficiency of a refrigerator can be calculated using the formula:

Efficiency = (Cooling Power) / (Input Power)

In this case, the cooling power is 250 Watts and the input power is 500 Watts. So the efficiency can be calculated as:

Efficiency = 250 Watts / 500 Watts = 0.5

To express the efficiency as a percentage, multiply by 100:

Efficiency = 0.5 * 100 = 50%

So, the efficiency of the refrigerator is 50%.
